physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Distal pin and vibratory sense loss, absent ankle reflexes, equivocally ataxic heel-knee-shin testing. Mental status, cranial nerves, motor, and gait examinations were normal.
Encephalopathic, with agitation and hallucinations. He had ataxia, scanning speech, vertical nystagmus, acral hypesthesia, and absent ankle reflexes. Unable to urinate for several days.

Much improved but still noted mild gait imbalance, paresthesias below the knees, irritability, and difficulty concentrating. Reduced vibration, pin, and touch sensation in the feet but normal-to-brisk tendon reflexes, and a broad-based gait with impaired tandem walking.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement regarding gait imbalance and paresthesias.
